Description: Body sherd of Attic, possibly black-figured, pottery Gordion cup; interior: to the centre, band of alternate added red and black tongues; faded added white dots between tongues and lines dividing tongues; added red on alternate tongues laid directly on clay, but apparently deliberately effaced (Robertson); to the outside, two rows of staggered dots between sets of three lines; exterior: glazed black with one reserved band.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1888,0601.424, 1888,0601.425, 1888,0601.427, 1888,0601.215, 1948,0815.2 and Cambridge, Fitzwilliam GR.206.1894. The pieces are gathered in Hirayama, H. 2010 Kleitias and Attic Black-figure Vases in the Sixth Century B.C., pl. 25.
Bibliographic references: Brijder Siana III 2000 / Siana Cups III: The Red-black Painter, Griffin-bird Painter, and Siana Cups resembling Lip-cups (p. 556, no. G2) (Ergotimos-Kleitias Group)
Robertson 1951 / Gordion cups from Naukratis (p. 143, no. 1)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 381, no. B533)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 153, note 82)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 230, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0422) (Phase 1)
